documentation.text:
@title Auto Appealable Arbitrator
  @dev This is a centralized arbitrator which either gives direct rulings or provides a time and fee for appeal.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Can only be called by the owner."

arguments.value: Can only be called by the owner.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Can only be called by the owner."

@dev Cost of arbitration. Accessor to arbitrationPrice.
  @return fee Amount to be paid.

devdoc.details: This is a centralized arbitrator which either gives direct rulings or provides a time and fee for appeal.

appeal(uint256,bytes).details: Appeal a ruling. Note that it has to be called before the arbitrator contract calls rule.

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute to be appealed.
params._extraData: Can be used to give extra info on the appeal.

appealCost(uint256,bytes).details: Cost of appeal. If appeal is not possible, it's a high value which can never be paid.

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute to be appealed.

appealPeriod(uint256).details: Compute the start and end of the dispute's current or next appeal period, if possible.

arbitrationCost(bytes).details: Cost of arbitration. Accessor to arbitrationPrice.

changeAppealFee(uint256,uint256).details: Change the appeal fee of a dispute.

params._appealCost: The new cost to appeal this ruling.
params._disputeID: The ID of the dispute to update.

constructor.details: Constructor. Set the initial arbitration price.

params._arbitrationPrice: Amount to be paid for arbitration.

createDispute(uint256,bytes).details: Create a dispute. Must be called by the arbitrable contract.  Must be paid at least arbitrationCost().

params._choices: Amount of choices the arbitrator can make in this dispute. When ruling <= choices.
params._extraData: Can be used to give additional info on the dispute to be created.

currentRuling(uint256).details: Return the ruling of a dispute.

returns.ruling: The ruling which have been given or which would be given if no appeals are raised.

disputeStatus(uint256).details: Return the status of a dispute (in the sense of ERC792, not the Dispute property).

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute to rule.

executeRuling(uint256).details: Execute the ruling of a dispute after the appeal period has passed. UNTRUSTED.

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute to execute.
ID of the dispute to rule.
params._ruling: Ruling given by the arbitrator. Note that 0 means "Not able/wanting to make a decision".
params._timeToAppeal: The time to appeal the ruling.

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute to rule.
params._ruling: Ruling given by the arbitrator. Note that 0 means "Not able/wanting to make a decision".

setArbitrationPrice(uint256).details: Set the arbitration price. Only callable by the owner.

params._arbitrationPrice: Amount to be paid for arbitration.

devdoc.title: Auto Appealable Arbitrator
